result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Richard Armstrong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

11:06 AM Defendant Andrew Richard Armstrong in court.  Attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz in court for Andrew Richard Armstrong.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads not contest to count 1. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1. Count 2 is dismissed and read in. Court orders sentence withheld 2 years probation. Defendant must report to probation today. Costs due within 60 days. Sentence credit 3 days.

Request to appear remotely
September 19, 2022 No indication of State's position. Court will not try to track down assigned ADA to determine if any objection. Insufficient time for a hearing on the request prior to the scheduled plea date. Denied.

records.addlTxt: 03:06 PM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew Richard Armstrong appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz appeared by video for Andrew Richard Armstrong. Warrant vacated. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $1000 set with conditions of no contact directly or indirectly with victim J.R.B., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No Contact with Sarah Wobig, No Driving at all, Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Maintain absolute sobriety, Curfew 6 pm to 6 am. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled August 31, 2022 at 1:00pm.
